intro: Forgetina, commonly known as the "blue forget-me-not," is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers, which are typically arranged in clusters at the end of its stems. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Native to regions of Europe and Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Forgetina is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and symbolic association with remembrance.
